comments:
On some ws combinations, setting an explicit background color on ToolBar is 
not passed onto tool items - they still retain the default system background.

Example:

1) Open Welcome on Windows XP without the manifest file
2) Click on 'Go To Workbench' link
3) Observe the launch bar in the window trim - it has purple background but 
the tool items are still gray.

This works with the manifest file.

ToolBar instance is created with the SWT.FLAT style.
I think I have seen this on Mac as well.

I can't show the welcome page in eclipse-SDK-I20050419-1200-win32.  I get the 
following exception:

What is that launch bar anyways?

When you click on 'Go to workbench', welcome is closed and animation is 
started that zooms into one of the window trim areas to show a control that 
hosts a tool bar. The tool bar contains tool item that match the root links on 
the Welcome page, allowing you to quickly return to it (in SDK, there are 
buttons for 'Overview', 'Tutorials', 'Samples' and 'News'). 

We wanted to make a visual association with the welcome page by setting the 
background color to match the Welcome purple. However, in some os/ws 
combinations only the tool bar is purple, while the items are stock gray.

Try one of the previous builds - essentially anything since M6.

I just fixed 91302 which might be related to what you are seeing.  Are you 
running with the manifest?  I still can't test it because I get the 
exception.  Can you please see if the problem is fixed?
The problem does not happen when running with, only without manifest.
Sounds like it's another case of bug 91302.  Hope it goes away!
It does look a lot like bug 91302. I will give the nightly a try.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 91302 ***
